translated: surrounded by a group of women,
the god of gods, the bull of men,
Seeing him with his pain allayed,
and made a wish in the past.

analyzed: disvā mama suppasannatta  id hiyā pāramiṅgataḥ
translated: Seeing my faith,🔽the one who had perfected psychic power,
the hero rose up into the sky
like a king of geese in the sky.
I do not know of any bad destination,
this is the fruit of the ghee and oil.
… the Buddha’s instruction has been done.”

original: Itthaṁ sudaṁ āyasmā sappidāyako thero imā gāthāyo abhāsitthāti.
analyzed: ittham sudam āyasmā sappidāyakaḥ theraḥ imāḥ gāthāyaḥ abhāsittha ati
translated: Thus has the venerable Sappadāyaka told this verse.
The Story of the Elder Sappadāyaka is finished.
